actions.in_committee: House Committee on Ways and Means
actions.text: Referred to Subcommittee on Social Security.

official_title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce, from age 70 to the retirement age, the age beyond which deductions on account of an individual's outside earnings will no longer be made from such individual's benefits.
subjects: Old age, survivors and disability insurance
subjects_top_term: Old age, survivors and disability insurance

summary.text: Amends title II (Old Age, Survivors and Disability Insurance) of the Social Security Act to reduce, from age 70 to retirement age, the age beyond which deductions on account of an individual's noncovered earnings outside the United States will no longer be made from such individual's benefits.

titles.title: A bill to amend title II of the Social Security Act to reduce, from age 70 to the retirement age, the age beyond which deductions on account of an individual's outside earnings will no longer be made from such individual's benefits.
